page.title: 16Ubley Trout Hatchery
page.content: The greatest claim to fame in the area is probably the Trout Hatchery at Ubley at the eastern end of Blagdon Lake which exports ova all over the world. Trout bred there are now swimming in the rivers of countries as far apart as Kenya, South Africa, New Zealand and the Far East. The spawning season for brown trout begins in late October: rainbow trout spawn later, usually from February to April. The fish are caught in an auto- matic fish trap, placed in concrete- lined ponds, and eggs stripped from them and fertilised. They are then taken to the hatchery house where they are placed in specially designed woven baskets immersed in shallow troughs through which a continuous stream of water flows. The fry are artificially fed, they are 9 months old when they are used to restock the local lakes.
